--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Gordon Mohr (archive.org)"
<gojomo=
@...> wrote:
>
> We haven't implemented a general/better solution. I know t=
hat some
> projects have (and are probably still) probing for whether a sit=
e
> gives such 'soft 404s' by requesting a random path URL on the host,
> a=
nd seeing if a 200 comes back. Presumably they could also use the
> content=
 of that page as a hint to detect other 'soft 404s' on the
> site. (Though,=
 many of these situations are caused by scripts that
> affect only part of =
the URL space, not the whole site.)

Ahh...interesting idea Gordon.  I like=
 it.  I'm still not sure how
large of a problem this will be for us, but I'=
ll pursue something
along these lines if it is a big issue, and I'll be sur=
e to contribute
back.

Thanks.

-Adam
